subject: Re: [junit] a test pattern ?
msgSnippet: ... This page is not JUnit specific, but it looks like a good start: http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?TestingPatterns There are a number of books that contain testing
messageBody:
At 5:52 PM -0400 4/22/05, Chris Downey wrote:
>The more I thought about this, the more I'm wondering if there is a
>known collection of JUnit test patterns. Any thoughts on this?

This page is not JUnit specific, but it looks like a good start:

http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?TestingPatterns

There are a number of books that contain testing patterns. Ross
Rainsberger's "JUnit Recipes" was just recommended. I'd had good luck
with the "Java Extreme Programming Cookbook" by Eric M. Burke and
Brian M. Coyner and with Kent's "Test Driven Development". I mean to
pick up a few others.

The archives of this list can be fruitful as well.

--
Adam Wildavsky adam@... http://www.tameware.com
